job_description:
Design trifft Code, Code trifft Impact: Wir bauen digitale Produkte, die die Zukunft gestalten. Willkommen in deinem nächsten Abenteuer.

Wir sind eine digitale Produktagentur, die den Fokus auf Innovation und gesellschaftlichen Mehrwert legt. In einem inspirierenden Umfeld arbeiten unsere leidenschaftlichen Entwickler_innen_Hand in Hand mit kreativen Designern_innen\_, um Software zu entwickeln, die mehr als nur technisch ausgereift sind – sie machen einen echten Unterschied.

Flache Hierarchien sind bei uns nicht nur ein Buzzword, sondern gelebte Realität. Wir kommunizieren offen, direkt und auf Augenhöhe, denn wir glauben, dass die besten Ideen in einer lockeren Atmosphäre entstehen

Wir investieren in deine Weiterentwicklung, denn wir wachsen, wenn du wächst.

Also, bereit für dein nächstes Abenteuer?

Aufgaben


 * Evaluation und Umsetzung von PoCs in verschiedensten Bereichen und Technologien im Rahmen unserer Innovationsbestrebungen
 * Unterstützung bei Auswertungen von maßgeblichen Technologieentscheidungen

Qualifikation


 * Breites Know-how: Frontend, Backend, DevOps, Cloud bzw. Infrastruktur
 * Fähigkeit, sich in kurzer Zeit in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten
 * Bonus: Bereits Erfahrung im Bereich KI

Für diese Position suchen wir explizit Generalisten und keine Spezialisten.

Benefits

1. Arbeite an Projekten mit Impact! Wir bringen Dich mit revolutionären Startups und Vorreitern der Industrie zusammen, um gemeinsam an Produkten zu arbeiten, die die Gesellschaft positiv beeinflussen."
2. "Keine Standard-Mentor-Mentee-Dynamik: Lerne durch aktive Beteiligung und individuell abgestimmtes Coaching von Branchenexperten, die wirklich wissen, wie der Hase läuft."
3. "Bei uns gibt's keine starren 9-to-5-Schichten. Deine Uhr, dein Zeitplan – Jeder hat seine eigene Arbeitsweise und das fördern wir gerne."
4. "Unsere Büros sind mehr als nur vier Wände. Erwarte Top-Ausstattung, zwei Terrassen, eine Küche voller kostenloser Snacks, die weit über den obligatorischen Bürokaffee hinausgehen."
5. "Lebe besser mit unseren VIP-Vorteilen. Von exklusiven Shopping-Rabatten bis zu ermäßigten Fitnessmitgliedschaften – wir sorgen dafür, dass sich Arbeit mehr als nur auszahlt."
6. "Wir sind Teamplayer ohne Ego-Trips. Bei uns gibt's keine Titel und keine Hierarchien, die im Weg stehen."
7. "Langeweile ist bei uns ein Fremdwort. Unsere Team-Events sind mehr als nur obligatorisches Networking. Erwarte Spaß, der die Batterien wirklich wieder auflädt."
8. "Überdurchschnittliche Bezahlung ist für uns Standard. Wir schätzen Deine Skills und lassen das auch auf dem Gehaltszettel spüren."

job_description:
YOUR MISSION



 * Technical conception, engineering, integration and testing of reliable backend applications using Scala
 * Maintenance and monitoring of the applications you build with the team
 * Technical investigations and prototyping of future solutions
 * Integration of evolving technologies and industry trends



YOUR PROFILE



 * You have experience in developing backend services, preferably with Scala
 * Alternatively, you have experience developing backend services with Java
 * Knowledge of web development basics: HTTP, REST, SQL
 * You are a team player and willing to work on continuous improvement
 * You are interested in upskilling in other areas of software engineering
 * You are experienced in working with agile methodologies
 * You are able to write and speak English

You get extra points for:
 * Knowledge of functional programming patterns
 * Any hands on knowledge of our current tech stack: scala 2.13, akka-http, cats, aws, postgres
 * Or our future tech stack: scala 3, zio, tapir, sttp
 * CI (Jenkins, CircleCI, etc)
 * Unit testing and TDD
 * Experience using banking APIs



WHY US?

We offer you a permanent position in one of the most exciting areas of Munich - the Glockenbachviertel. Here, you can fully enjoy the vibrant city life.

In addition, we offer you tax-free employee benefits that complement your attractive salary and make your workday easier:

 * Daily meal allowance: Enjoy your lunch every workday subsidized by Spendit
 * Salary extras via the SpenditCard: Look forward to a monthly balance on your Visa card, which you can use individually
 * Discounted Deutschlandticket: Benefit from a monthly subsidy for the Deutschlandticket for both business and private use
   

This way, you can enjoy your meals, travel environmentally friendly, and benefit from tax-free in-kind benefits. What more could you ask for?

We place great value on work-life balance. Therefore, we offer flexible working hours and the option to work remotely.
With us, you have numerous development opportunities. We support your professional development both internally and externally, and each employee receives a training budget for this purpose.

We believe that a positive work environment leads to peak performance, so a shared lunch break, team events, and office gatherings are part of our corporate culture.

Short decision-making processes and flat hierarchies are a given here. Your commitment and ideas are valued and appreciated.

And by the way, dogs are also welcome here! Our office is dog-friendly and offers a pleasant working atmosphere for everyone.

We look forward to welcoming you. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that not only develops great products but also creates a fantastic work environment. At SPENDIT, you can advance your career while leading a fulfilling life. Apply now and let's celebrate success together!




ABOUT US

Spendit AG is the company you've been waiting for! As a multi-award-winning and fast-growing B2B SaaS start-up based in the heart of Munich, we are the pioneers when it comes to employee benefits. With our innovative products, the Lunchit App, the SpenditCard and attractive mobility solutions, we are revolutionizing the way companies support their employees. Our Spendit solutions go beyond mere benefits. They bring appreciation and motivation to everyday working life. So, are you ready to revolutionize the world of benefits? Join us and become part of a company that is changing the way organizations value their employees. At Spendit AG you have the chance to contribute your ideas and shape the future of the working world together with us. Let's achieve great things together!

We have been awarded a Kununu Top Company since 2022. Here you can find real feedback from our employees and applicants.

job_description:
München




DEINE NEUE ROLLE

Als Teil eines unserer Münchner Entwicklerteams unterstützt du uns bei der Weiterentwicklung einer Software, die täglich tausende medizinische Angestellte nutzen.

 * Du entwickelst als Full-Stack-Engineer aktiv an Frontend und Backend mit.
 * Du arbeitest eng mit Kolleg:innen in regelmäßigen Pair-Programming-Sessions zusammen.
 * Du hilfst uns Best Practices umzusetzen und agile Softwareentwicklung zu leben.


DEINE ERFAHRUNG & PERSÖNLICHKEIT

 * Du studierst Informatik oder in einem vergleichbaren Bereich.
 * Du hast Spaß an Softwareentwicklung und beherrscht Java, JavaScript, PHP, Python oder React
 * Du hast erste Erfahrungen mit Web- oder Cloud Applikationen.
 * Du begeisterst dich für Clean Code und Solid.
 * Du sprichst fließend Englisch.
 * Deutsche Sprachkenntnisse.

Bonuspunkte sind:

 * Erfahrung mit weiteren Technologien aus unserem Tech-Stack (z.B. JavaScript, Kafka, AWS, Docker)
 * Erfahrung mit unseren Entwicklungstools (z.B. GitHub, Jira)



DAS ERWARTET DICH

 * Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben und viel Raum für eigene Ideen.
 * Kleine Teams, flache Hierarchien und internationale Kolleg:innen.
 * Einen modernen, cloud-nativen Tech-Stack (React, JavaScript, TypeScript, Kafka, MySQL, AWS Lambda, Docker).
 * Faires Gehalt, flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice Möglichkeiten.
 * Natürlich eine Start-up-Kultur mit Tischtennis, Xbox und Paulaner Spezi sowie regelmäßigen Firmenveranstaltungen (z.B. Wiesntisch).


DAS ERWARTET DICH! UNSERE BENEFITS


MÖGLICHKEIT, SEINEN HUND MIT INS BÜRO ZU BRINGEN


JE NACH ZUGEHÖRIGKEIT 28 BIS 30 TAGE


MOBILES & FLEXIBLES ARBEITEN


49-EURO-DEUTSCHLAND-TICKET ALS BEZUSCHUSSTES JOBTICKET


GESUNDHEITSTAGE


MENTAL HEALTH MIT DEM FÜRSTENBERG INSTITUT


ZUSCHUSS URBAN SPORTS CLUB


CORPORATE BENEFITS


ENTWICKLUNGSMASSNAHMEN & -MÖGLICHKEITEN


EVENTS & ÜBERRASCHUNGEN


ZENTRAL GELEGENE MODERNE BÜROS MIT HÖHENVERSTELLBAREN SCHREIBTISCHEN UND GETRÄNKEAUSWAHL


FEEDBACKGESPRÄCHE


UMFASSENDE EINARBEITUNG UND GRUPPENWEITE ONBOARDING TAGE


THIS IS WHAT AWAITS YOU! OUR BENEFITS


THE POSSIBILITY TO BRING YOUR DOG TO THE OFFICE.


MOBILE & FLEXIBLE WORKING POSSIBILITIES.


JOB-BIKE


MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT WITH THE FÜRSTENBERG INSTITUTE


CORPORATE BENEFITS


EVENTS & SURPRISES


CENTRALLY LOCATED, MODERN OFFICES WITH HEIGHT-ADJUSTABLE DESKS AND A WIDE SELECTION OF DRINKS


28 TO 30 DAYS' HOLIDAY DEPENDING ON SENIORITY


49-EURO GERMANY TICKET (DEUTSCHLAND-TICKET) AS SUBSIDISED JOB TICKET


HEALTHDAYS AT THE OFFICE


URBAN SPORTS CLUB SUBSIDY


DEVELOPMENT MEASURES & OPPORTUNITIES


CONTRIBUTION TO RETIREMENT PROVISION


MOBILE WORKING FROM OTHER EU COUNTRIES (MAX. 10 WORKING DAYS PER YEAR)


MEAL ALLOWANCE (CASH SALARY CONVERSION)


PLANERIO GMBH

Planerio revolutioniert das Workforce-Management im Gesundheitswesen. Mit unserer KI-basierten Software, der Smartphone-App und unserem technologischen Vorsprung digitalisieren und automatisieren wir alle Prozesse rund um den Personaleinsatz. Damit erhöhen wir nicht nur die Effizienz, sondern tragen auch erheblich zur Steigerung der Motivation und Zufriedenheit der Belegschaft unserer KundInnen bei. Intelligente Dienstplanung, Zeiterfassung, Lohnbuchhaltung, Employee-Self-Service etc. machen Planerio zu dem modernen Betriebssystem für das Personalmanagement in der Gesundheitsbranche. Als Teil der doctari group bauen wir mit rund 70 Mitarbeitenden die Plattform der Zukunft! Bei uns im Münchener Office ist immer was los. Sei es zu unserem Klassiker der Wiesn aber auch zu anderen regelmäßigen tollen Events wie einer Cocktail-Party, einem Pub-Quiz oder gemeinsames Rätseln in einem Escape-Room. Wir kommen als Team immer wieder gerne zusammen, tauschen uns aus und haben Spaß miteinander.




PLANERIO GMBH

Planerio is revolutionizing workforce management in healthcare. With our AI-based software, smartphone app and our technological advantage, we digitize and automate all processes related to personnel deployment. In this way, we not only increase efficiency, but also contribute significantly to increasing the motivation and satisfaction of our customers' workforce. Intelligent shift scheduling, time recording, payroll accounting, employee self-service, etc. make Planerio the modern operating system for human resource management in the healthcare industry. As part of the doctari group, we are building the platform of the future with around 70 employees! There is always something going on in our Munich office. Be it our classic Oktoberfest or other regular great events such as a cocktail party, a pub quiz or puzzles together in an escape room. We always enjoy coming together as a team, exchanging ideas, and having fun together.







BIANCA GHERA

Recruiting Managerin Schwerpunkt Tech & Product






+40 755 974974




KATHI KORTE

Teamlead Talent Attraction & Recruiting






+49 172 1568790

job.description:
München

DEINE NEUE ROLLE

Als Teil eines unserer Münchner Entwicklerteams unterstützt du uns bei der Weiterentwicklung einer Software, die täglich tausende medizinische Angestellte nutzen.
  • Du entwickelst als Full-Stack-Engineer aktiv an Frontend und Backend mit.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit Kolleg:innen in regelmäßigen Pair-Programming-Sessions zusammen.
  • Du hilfst uns Best Practices umzusetzen und agile Softwareentwicklung zu leben.

DEINE ERFAHRUNG & PERSÖNLICHKEIT

  • Du studierst Informatik oder in einem vergleichbaren Bereich.
  • Du hast Spaß an Softwareentwicklung und beherrscht Java, JavaScript, PHP, Python oder React
  • Du hast erste Erfahrungen mit Web- oder Cloud Applikationen.
  • Du begeisterst dich für Clean Code und Solid.
  • Du sprichst fließend Englisch.
  • Deutsche Sprachkenntnisse.
Bonuspunkte sind:
  • Erfahrung mit weiteren Technologien aus unserem Tech-Stack (z.B. JavaScript, Kafka, AWS, Docker)
  • Erfahrung mit unseren Entwicklungstools (z.B. GitHub, Jira)

DAS ERWARTET DICH

  • Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben und viel Raum für eigene Ideen.
  • Kleine Teams, flache Hierarchien und internationale Kolleg:innen.
  • Einen modernen, cloud-nativen Tech-Stack (React, JavaScript, TypeScript, Kafka, MySQL, AWS Lambda, Docker).
  • Faires Gehalt, flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice Möglichkeiten.
  • Natürlich eine Start-up-Kultur mit Tischtennis, Xbox und Paulaner Spezi sowie regelmäßigen Firmenveranstaltungen (z.B. Wiesntisch).

job_title: Software Engineer at Y Combinator Startup
job_description:
We are CoCrafter (YC W24), a Munich-based start-up founded in 2023 with a mission to revolutionize collaboration processes in construction.

The construction industry is the backbone of the European economy but has been largely overlooked by digitization efforts. The result: inefficient processes and untapped potential.

Subcontracting is one of the most crucial processes in construction, and no large project can be realized without it. However, highly inefficient subcontracting processes lead to lost revenue and missed growth opportunities for contractors every day. This issue is further exacerbated by the ongoing labor shortage.

CoCrafter is the solution: Our platform enables contractors to find and manage subcontractors effectively—all in one place. We bring transparency and quality to a highly fragmented market.

Backed by top-tier investors, we are already helping some of the largest construction companies redefine their subcontracting processes. In 2024, we secured €1.7M in funding from Y Combinator, 10x Founders, and other investors, positioning us to scale rapidly.

Tasks

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join our growing team. You will be part of the engineers who build up our product in close collaboration with the founders. This hands-on role is perfect for a resourceful and adaptable individual who thrives in a startup environment and is passionate about developing innovative products.

Responsibilities


 * Software Development: Build scalable, modular solutions (Typescript, Next.js, Nest.js) for our product.
 * Product Mindset: Contribute to an exceptional user experience by always keeping our end-users in mind. Or with YC words: make something people want.
 * Cross-functional Communication: Strong work ethic, team player, very good communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and even customers.
 * Techie at Heart: Be passionate about developing & implementing a diverse set of complex features while ensuring the delivery of scalable, maintainable, and performant software.

Optional: Further development and maintaining of our deployment pipeline (Github Actions) and cloud infrastructure set-up (AWS, Terraform, Docker)

Requirements

We believe that problem-solving, creativity, and ambition are most important. Tools and technologies can be picked up. However, the following references will give a guideline of what experiences we think might be helpful.


 * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
 * Preferably 1+ year of previous Internships or Working Student positions
 * Experience with building scalable and reusable key components for front-end and backend applications, ideally with Javascript and Typescript, Node.js and its ecosystem
 * First experience with PostgreSQL database or similar relational databases and REST APIs
 * First experience by deploying applications to cloud services such as Azure, GCP or AWS
 * Collaborative team spirit, proactive mindset and ability to quickly learn new things
 * Fluent in Englisch and understand German conversational (B2 or +)
 * Start: As soon as possible

A plus: You worked in an (early-stage) start-up before and know what it is like to join a fast-paced environment

Benefits

‍ ️Top-tier founder, investor, and advisor network for your personal development

Attractive compensation including stock options

️ 28 days of vacation per year

️‍ ️ A fitness subscription to keep pushing or relax outside of the office ;)

Any hard- and software you need for your work


 * ️ Fun team events such as bowling & mini golf, retreats, and regular feedback
 * ️ A beautiful office in the center of Munich with free snacks and a (funny) Barista

Why You Should Join Us


 * Impact: After less than a year, our customers can no longer imagine life without our product. Your work will help redefining an entire industry
 * Growth: Being one of the employees in a start-up is an unique opportunity to grow with a team of 1-10 to >500. We see you as in a leadership position to facilitate that growth!
 * Team: We are an interdisciplinary, dynamic & supportive team that has fun building something extraordinary. Work with us to develop both personally and professionally!

job_title: Optimization Engineer (m/f/d) for Operations Research in the Field of Energy Management Software
job_description:
EnopAI is a software startup in its early stages, originating from Rudolf Hörmann GmbH & Co. KG. Over the past few years, we have developed an innovative energy management software solution that optimizes the operation of complex energy systems in real-time. Our software leverages the flexibility of existing components, such as PV systems, battery storage, electric vehicles, and combined heat and power (CHP) plants, to significantly reduce total energy costs through intelligent orchestration based on mathematics and AI. With our advanced solution, we aim to support manufacturing companies and industrial clients with complex, sector-coupled energy systems in reducing both costs and emissions, thus contributing actively to the energy transition. Would you like to help shape the future of energy management and be part of a groundbreaking development? Then join our team as an Optimization Engineer (m/f/d) for Operations Research in the Field of Energy Management Software.




OPTIMIZATION ENGINEER (M/F/D) FOR OPERATIONS RESEARCH IN THE FIELD OF ENERGY MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE

in München |
Startdatum: Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt |
Anstellungsart: Vollzeit



Aufgaben

 * Modeling and Optimization: Further development and implementation of existing mathematical models for optimizing energy consumption and resource utilization in industrial companies
 * Algorithm Design: Creation and adaptation of optimization algorithms to establish new application areas within our energy management software
 * Process Optimization: Continuous improvement and automation of existing energy management processes in our software
 * Simulation and Scenario Analysis: Development and application of simulation models to analyze various energy demand scenarios and evaluate their impact on costs and resources
 * Consulting and Collaboration: Close cooperation with our software developers and management to integrate optimization solutions



Profil

 * You have completed a degree in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a similar field
 * Solid knowledge in mathematical modeling, simulation, and optimization (e.g., MILP)
 * Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python, C++, or C#
 * Ideally, you have knowledge in energy efficiency, energy management, and sustainability



Ihre Perspektive:

 * A permanent and secure job in an innovative company
 * Attractive remuneration
 * Capital-forming benefits
 * Christmas bonus
 * JobRad, monthly shopping voucher, EGYM Wellpass
 * Employee events such as summer party, Christmas party, company outings
 * A positive work environment with a long-standing team of employees



Herr Tim Rauhut

+49 8241 9682354
✉️ karriere@hoermann-info.com

job_description:
Location: Munich / Sofia
When building software, you go through many stages. From initial requirements to product launch, it’s integral to ensure that everything works according to specification.

That’s why we’re looking for a quality assurance engineer to help us maintain our high level of quality and reliability.

By joining our team, you will take part in various projects, assessing software quality by designing and implementing software testing processes. You will take ownership of code quality through exploratory and automated tests. You will hunt bugs, identify issues, report them, and see that they’re dealt with.
At least 2 years of experience in the field of Quality Assurance with Web Sites, Desktop applications or Mobile applications
Strong experience building automated test scripts using Selenium, Java, etc.
Experience with testing/developing web-based application.
Familiarity with unit test development
Experience with at least one Bug tracking tool - Jira
Good understanding of most common QA Terms & Practices – Sanity, Regression, STD/ TestCase, Bug Life Cycle, etc.
Very good understanding of Software Development Life Cycle;
Fluent verbal and written English language;
Comfortable working directly with developers;
Highly organized and detail oriented.

job_description:
Vollzeit | Hybrid | Weisenheim | Karlsruhe | München

Software Engineers bei zebrafant.ai entwickeln skalierbare Lösungen, die einen spürbaren Einfluss auf das Abfallmanagement haben. Als Software Engineer übernimmst du die volle Verantwortung für den gesamten Entwicklungsprozess und Code, vom Systemdesign über die Anwendungsentwicklung bis hin zur Bereitstellung. Du arbeitest eng mit Kunden zusammen und verbesserst unsere Produkte kontinuierlich durch schnelle Iterationen.

Deine Hauptaufgaben

 * Schreibe sauberen, effizienten und production-ready Code und setze ihn in Betrieb.
 * Entwickle und konzipiere neue Features, die nahtlos in unsere KI-gestützten Modelle integriert werden.
 * Beeinflusse direkt die Integration neuer Technologien in unseren Tech-Stack.
 * Hole Feedback von Kunden und Kollegen ein, um das Produkt nachhaltig zu verbessern.
 * Arbeite sowohl eigenständig als auch im Team, um komplexe Herausforderungen zu lösen.

Was wir suchen

 * M.Sc. in Informatik, Mathematik oder einem verwandten Bereich.
 * Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python, Go oder C++.
 * Kenntnisse in Datenstrukturen, Cloud-Infrastrukturen, API-Design und Frontend-Frameworks.
 * Fähigkeit, kontinuierlich zu lernen und eigenständige Entscheidungen zu treffen.
 * Fähigkeit zur Zusammenarbeit mit technischen und nicht-technischen Teammitgliedern.
 * Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse; Deutsch ist von Vorteil.
 * Erfahrung in Statistik, ML oder mathematischer Optimierung ist von Vorteil.

job_title: Software Engineer Internship - Apple Vision Pro
job_description:
Summary

Posted: Oct 23, 2024

Weekly Hours: 40

Role Number:200575259

Apple Vision Pro is a revolutionary spatial computer that seamlessly blends digital content with your physical space. It will allow us to do the things we love in ways never before possible - all while staying connected to the people around us. As an intern in the Apple Vision Pro team, you will join a team of engineers to discover and build solutions that will shape the future of spatial-computing. You will have the rare and rewarding opportunity to contribute to upcoming products that will delight and inspire millions of Apple’s customers every single day. We are part of the ARKit team within VPG. Our team has a successful track record of delivering realtime algorithms on both iOS and visionOS platforms.

Description

You will work in a cross-functional team that develops innovative computer vision/machine learning systems and advanced visualization applications. As an intern in our group, you will gain hands-on experience with professional software development, working with internal stakeholders to ensure that their needs are met. Additionally, you will have many opportunities relating to the design and implementation of the architecture and framework of our developer facing API.

Minimum Qualifications

 * Enrolled in a degree in Computer Science or equivalent
 * Familiarity with Objective-C or Swift
 * Familiarity with iOS development
 * Fantastic attention to detail
 * Excellent communication and teamwork skills


Preferred Qualifications

 * Experience with Apple's APIs and frameworks (e.g. AVFoundation, GCD)
 * Familiarity with visionOS development
 * Availability for 6 months minimum is preferred

job.jobTitleText: Software Engineer Internship - Apple Vision Pro

job_description:
Passionate about software engineering, compiler technology and Java? Are you excited to solve challenging problems and build cool software that is used on billions of devices? Join our Java team!




OUR TECHNOLOGY

We develop the successful open-source project ProGuard and the cutting-edge security product DexGuard. Using compiler technology, obfuscation, encryption, and optimization techniques we make Java and Android applications smaller, faster, and more hardened against reverse engineering and tampering.




REQUIRED SKILLS

 * Deep knowledge of Java
 * At least 2-3 years of experience in a similar role

USEFUL SKILLS

 * Experience with Linux
 * Interest in low level programming
 * Knowledge of compiler technology (Java bytecode, complex application processing) or knowledge of obfuscation or optimization technologies
 * Knowledge of information security
 * Experience with reverse engineering and the commonly used tools
 * Familiarity with Android and the Android build tools: Gradle, ProGuard...




PROFILE

We are looking for a Master in Computer Science (or equivalent practical experience) with good verbal and written communication skills in English.




TEAM

Guardsquare is a software product company with small international teams that solve challenging problems and create high quality products. You will be part of the team working on our open source product ProGuard, our commercial product DexGuard, and new products based on Java technology. This will give you a ton of opportunities to have a direct impact on the products, features and workflow. New techniques you come up with for the next wave of optimization and hardening could potentially be in use at really big companies within a couple of weeks (among our customers are many of the biggest payment processors, banks, social media companies…). Every team member designs, develops, maintains and improves our software and provides email support to our customers. They also get the opportunity to research the latest compiler and mobile security technology.




What Guardsquare offers you


 * A full time job with a competitive salary package
 * You are provided with the tools & flexibility to develop yourself successfully
 * An international environment where you will interact with motivated & open colleagues with different backgrounds
 * A workplace where you can share and implement your ideas
 * A hybrid work policy, which helps guarantee an excellent work-life balance



At Guardsquare, we take pride in being a diverse and multicultural company with team members representing numerous nationalities. We value different perspectives and opinions throughout the business which has contributed to our being the market leader in mobile application security.
You will be part of a dynamic team that strives for excellence and focuses on continuous education and enhancement in skills. We encourage & empower our trusted colleagues to share their opinions, actively collaborate, and continue to learn and grow.


So, what are you waiting for? Join us!
You can apply for this opportunity by filling out the application form below!


About Guardsquare


Guardsquare offers the most complete approach to mobile application security on the market. Built on the open source ProGuard technology, Guardsquare's software integrates seamlessly across the development cycle. From app security testing to code hardening to real-time visibility into the threat landscape, Guardsquare solutions provide enhanced mobile application security from early in the development process through publication.
More than 900 customers worldwide across all major industries rely on Guardsquare to help them identify security risks and protect their mobile applications against reverse engineering and tampering.
Guardsquare is based in Leuven (Belgium) with offices in Gent (Belgium) Boston (USA) and Munich (Germany).

job_description:
INTRODUCTION SENTENCE

Become part of the Verivox team!




We are looking for you! We offer a full-time position (40h/week) in one of our locations in either Heidelberg, Berlin, Leipzig or Munich . The offer includes the option of working several days per week in the mobile office. Software Engineer - DevOps Focus (m/f/d)


YOUR MISSION

 * Help us maintaining and further developing our technology stack, nowadays mostly written in .NET, with clean and well-documented code.
 * Care about the deployment lifecycle of the application with automation to build, test and deploy with Jenkins
 * Lead the effort and develop best practices to modernize and containerize applications and be comfortable with container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes
 * Ensure the health and performance of the applications are in place with our Elasticsearch observability stack
 * Elevate the team by providing technical guidance and support for DevOps practices
 * Stay up-to-date with the Internal Engineering community of Verivox by taking part of our cross-functional groups
 * Contribute to code quality and implement engineering best practices;
 * Demonstrate leadership qualities by mentoring junior team members and fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation;
 * Participate actively in team-building activities and support conflict moderation and resolution;
 * Engage in people development activities, including professional growth, training, and performance reviews.


YOUR ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

 * A university degree in a relevant field of study (computer science, engineering, sciences or a comparable qualification).
 * Several years of experience in automating deployments, testing, and monitoring.
 * Strong knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, IaC, and Jenkins.
 * Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or AWS.
 * Proven leadership potential, demonstrated through proactive problem-solving, effective collaboration, and a commitment to team success.
 * Fluent in spoken and written English, with German as a plus.


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

 * Around 500 employees from over 35 nations as a collegial community
 * Open and diverse corporate culture with flat hierarchies, as well as a modern and appreciative working environment
 * Generous Mobile office regulations enabling flexible work from home and within the EU
 * Individual area of responsibility with space for the development of one's own ideas and concepts
 * Uncomplicated cooperation: we are on first-name terms & don't insist on dress codes
 * Exclusive employee benefits such as a job ticket, job bike, lunch subsidies via Sodexo, and employee discounts
 * Company health management, including company pension schemes, Urban Sports Club, Crossfit, and Mental Health Days
 * Centrally located offices in Heidelberg, Berlin, Munich, and Leipzig with optimal transportation connections


CLOSURE

Are you up to meet these exciting challenges?

If so, then we would love to talk to you. Tell us how you will contribute to our success story! Please send your application (including your salary expectation and the earliest possible date of starting to work) via “Apply now” or to jobs@verivox.com .

Verivox is one of the leading online comparison portals in Germany. Since 1998, we have been making markets transparent in the areas of electricity & gas, mobile phones & internet and finance & insurance. We find the best offer for consumers from around 30,000 tariffs, helping households to save time and money. With our help more than 8 million customers have already saved over 2 billion euros. Since 2015, Verivox has been part of the ProSiebenSat.1 Group.


COMPANY TEXT

Click here to learn more about the ProSiebenSat.1 Group and our diverse portfolio.

You have a disability and would like to apply? Then you are very welcome.
We know that we are not entirely accessible yet, but we are working on it. Let's talk about how we can eliminate any barrier together and find an individual solution if needed.

Although we refer to one gender in the text, all genders may be implied.


 * Training and Education
 * Subsidized company pension plan
 * Flexible Working Hours
 * No dress code
 * Team Events
 * Open corporate culture
 * Exclusive employee benefits / discounts
 * Hybrid Work

job.description:
Introduction Sentence

Become part of the Verivox team!

We are looking for you! We offer a full-time position (40h/week) in one of our locations in either Heidelberg, Berlin, Leipzig or Munich . The offer includes the option of working several days per week in the mobile office. Software Engineer - DevOps Focus (m/f/d)

Your Mission

  • Help us maintaining and further developing our technology stack, nowadays mostly written in .NET, with clean and well-documented code.
  • Care about the deployment lifecycle of the application with automation to build, test and deploy with Jenkins
  • Lead the effort and develop best practices to modernize and containerize applications and be comfortable with container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes
  • Ensure the health and performance of the applications are in place with our Elasticsearch observability stack
  • Elevate the team by providing technical guidance and support for DevOps practices
  • Stay up-to-date with the Internal Engineering community of Verivox by taking part of our cross-functional groups
  • Contribute to code quality and implement engineering best practices;
  • Demonstrate leadership qualities by mentoring junior team members and fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation;
  • Participate actively in team-building activities and support conflict moderation and resolution;
  • Engage in people development activities, including professional growth, training, and performance reviews.

Your essential experience and education

  • A university degree in a relevant field of study (computer science, engineering, sciences or a comparable qualification).
  • Several years of experience in automating deployments, testing, and monitoring.
  • Strong knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, IaC, and Jenkins.
  • Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or AWS.
  • Proven leadership potential, demonstrated through proactive problem-solving, effective collaboration, and a commitment to team success.
  • Fluent in spoken and written English, with German as a plus.

What's in it for you?

  • Around 500 employees from over 35 nations as a collegial community
  • Open and diverse corporate culture with flat hierarchies, as well as a modern and appreciative working environment
  • Generous Mobile office regulations enabling flexible work from home and within the EU
  • Individual area of responsibility with space for the development of one's own ideas and concepts
  • Uncomplicated cooperation: we are on first-name terms & don't insist on dress codes
  • Exclusive employee benefits such as a job ticket, job bike, lunch subsidies via Sodexo, and employee discounts
  • Company health management, including company pension schemes, Urban Sports Club, Crossfit, and Mental Health Days
  • Centrally located offices in Heidelberg, Berlin, Munich, and Leipzig with optimal transportation connections

Closure

Are you up to meet these exciting challenges?

If so, then we would love to talk to you. Tell us how you will contribute to our success story! Please send your application (including your salary expectation and the earliest possible date of starting to work) via “Apply now” or to jobs@verivox.com .
